Text.val: 04.09.2012 AS SCR#17547 added support for Unicode control files to program, resp. codepage conversion
05.02.2009 GB SCR Small technical change for UniPaaS
There's two versions of mgword.dll. A Unicode and a Non-Unicode version and we can find out which one is in use
by checking the version string it returns. If its the Unicode version it only works with UTF-16LE control files, the ANSI
version can only read ANSI files. For that reasen we eventually have to change the character set of the file
check if we did create a Unicode control file by reading the BOM (Non-Unicode version of Factorlink
does not create Unicode files but ANSI which will be the case until migration is finished)
Unicode version of mgword.dll. If Factorlink created ANSI or UTF-8 we need to convert the
ANSI version of mgword.dll. If Factorlink created Unicode (UTF-8) we need to convert to ANSI
